Hop on and off the bus as you wish with a flexible ticket policy, meaning you can make the most of your Seoul experience at your own convenience. The best way to see the city, and discover one of Asia's most vibrant capitals.

You'll learn more about traditional Korean clothing and food whilst exploring the workshops and multiple other attractions at this splendid attraction. The village's grounds includes a Folk Museum and Art Museum where you are given the chance to get up close and personal with the secret behind making handmade baskets, musical instruments and embroidery for which the Joseon Dynasty of Korean was well known for. With over 260 replica Joseon Dynasty houses to explore, and daily traditional dances and live music performances to enjoy plus excellent food on site, this is a great way to start your Korea experience!

Apart from learning the secret behind making great kimchi, your hosts for the day will also let you try on a Hanbok, the Korean traditional costume. After snapping some shots of your Korean garb, enjoy your kimchi or take it home to eat later. The course is ideal for beginners, and is particularly focused on those hoping to learn more about Korean culture in an all-encompassing and practical manner. The professional instructors taking the class will teach you how to make kimchi step by step and tell you interesting historical and cultural facts about kimchi. The perfect food and culture class giving an introduction to Seoul!

Visit the most poignant sites of the struggle between North and South Korea. See where significant talks took place and visit the locations of ill-famed events Learn more about tensions between the Koreas and the wars that have resulted, from your informative English-speaking guide Enter the JSA to see Freedom House, Conference Room, Bridge of No Return and the Ax Murder Incident area Enjoy a delicious local lunch and hotel pick-up included Learn more about tensions between the Koreas and the wars that have resulted, from your informative English-speaking guide Learn more about tensions between the Koreas and the wars that have resulted, from your informative English-speaking guide Enter the JSA to see Freedom House, Conference Room, Bridge of No Return and the Ax Murder Incident area Enter the JSA to see Freedom House, Conference Room, Bridge of No Return and the Ax Murder Incident area Enjoy a delicious local lunch and hotel pick-up included Enjoy a delicious local lunch and hotel pick-up included What We Love:   What We Love: Delving into the heart of the history, this tour skips the outer edges of the DMZ and takes you to the Joint Security Area (JSA), also known as Panmunjom. This was the site of talks and negotiation between the two sides during the Korean wars. You'll visit the historical war monuments at Unification Park before a Korean restaurant lunch, after which you'll enter the JSA, accompanied by the expert knowledge of your guide. Visit Freedom House and the Conference room, site of various inter-Korean discussions, agreements and exchanges. The Bridge of No Return is next on the itinerary, the location of many POW exchanges, before a visit to the site of 1976's tragic Ax Murder Incident.

Get the most comprehensive tour of the no man's land between North and South Korea. Visit key sites of the DMZ in the morning and enter the high security area of the JSA in the afternoon Learn more about tensions between the Koreas and the wars that have resulted, from your informative English-speaking guide Visit famous sites of the DMZ including Imjingak Park, Freedom Bridge, the 3rd Infiltration Tunnel, the DMZ exhibition hall and the Dora Observatory Enter the JSA to see Freedom House, Conference Room, Bridge of No Return and the Ax Murder Incident area Enjoy a delicious local lunch and hotel pick-up included Learn more about tensions between the Koreas and the wars that have resulted, from your informative English-speaking guide Learn more about tensions between the Koreas and the wars that have resulted, from your informative English-speaking guide Visit famous sites of the DMZ including Imjingak Park, Freedom Bridge, the 3rd Infiltration Tunnel, the DMZ exhibition hall and the Dora Observatory Visit famous sites of the DMZ including Imjingak Park, Freedom Bridge, the 3rd Infiltration Tunnel, the DMZ exhibition hall and the Dora Observatory Enter the JSA to see Freedom House, Conference Room, Bridge of No Return and the Ax Murder Incident area Enter the JSA to see Freedom House, Conference Room, Bridge of No Return and the Ax Murder Incident area Enjoy a delicious local lunch and hotel pick-up included Enjoy a delicious local lunch and hotel pick-up included What We Love:   What We Love: Whether a fan of history and politics or not, a visit to the border territory between North and South Korea is an eye-opening experience. You'll travel to the Demilitarized Zone (DMZ), a buffer between the two sides, and explore historic sites including Imjingak Park, the Freedom Bridge and the secretly dug 3rd Infiltration Tunnel. After stopping for a local lunch, you'll be escorted through the checkpoint at Panmunjom (officially known as the Joint Security Area (JSA)), a supposedly neutral zone in times of war where the two sides met. Here you'll visit Freedom House and learn about the Bridge of No Return and the Ax Murder Incident. At which point you'll be able to say you have technically entered North Korea! If you currently feel like you lack knowledge on the subject, not to fear, you'll be an expert after taking this tour.

Visit famous filming locations as featured in a hit Korean TV show including Petite France and the Korean Folk Village with drop off at the K-Pop hologram hall! Whether a fan of the show or not, the locations and landmarks visited on this tour are not to be missed. Roam the quaint streets of Petite France and immerse yourself in the European vibes of charming cafes and French architecture. Then visit the Korean Folk Village, a Joseon Dynasty reconstruction, where you'll experience Korean life from as far back as the 14th Century. You can choose to visit 300m N Seoul Tower for amazing views of the city which ooze romance (it's a favored location for Seoulite couples). Pick up some duty-free bargains in downtown Seoul before the final stop (here's to you K-Pop lovers), a gallery where you can watch hologram performances!

Gyeongbokgung Palace, built in the 1300s, has been destroyed and reconstructed many times, but you'll be relieved it's still here today for you to stroll the spacious grounds, intricate architecture and grand pavilions. Combine this with a guided visit of the National Folk Museum and your knowledge of Korean history will be fit to burst! Along the way, your informative tour guide will relate facts about areas of interest, particularly related to the distinguished Joseon Dynasty. Realize the deep significance of Buddhism in Korean culture at Jogyesa Temple, a tranquil refuge from the megacity outside and the leading center of Zen Buddhism in Korea.

Marvel at the architecture of one of Seoul's most beautiful palaces, Gyeongbokgung. Resulting from a stormy history, ongoing reconstructions mean you can see original portions alongside modern efforts to restore it to its former glory. Reminisce to bygone days with a guided visit of the National Folk Museum before a tasty local lunch. After you're fully sated, you'll set off to visit palace no.2, UNESCO-listed Changdeokgung, a perfectly preserved architectural example from the Joseon Dynasty. Walk amongst the serenity of Jogyesa Buddhist Temple, peruse crafts and antiques on Insadong Street and pick up a holiday memento at Namdaemun before a comfortable transfer back to your hotel.

Begin with the beautiful pavilions and spacious grounds of Gyeongbokgung Palace, then your informative guide will lead you on a guided tour of the National Folk Museum to find out about the daily lives of Koreans spanning pre-historic times to the end of the Joseon Dynasty. Explore the peaceful grounds of Jogyesa Buddhist Temple before settling down for a traditional Korean meal. After lunch you'll experience a Joseon Dynasty throwback when you visit the Korean Folk Village. Walk amongst traditionally built houses, watch artisans in action at a handicraft workshop, join the audience of a folk performance, and even try your hand at traditional games such as arrow throwing and seesaw jumping!

Spend a half-day getting a real cultural insight into Korean customs, ceremony and the country's favorite fermented food – Kimchi! Attend a tea ceremony, and learn about Korean tea etiquette and its recent revival Try on a traditional hanbok and take a memorable photo Make kimchi and find out why it's a healthy Korean staple Enjoy the convenience of complimentary hotel transfers Attend a tea ceremony, and learn about Korean tea etiquette and its recent revival Attend a tea ceremony, and learn about Korean tea etiquette and its recent revival Try on a traditional hanbok and take a memorable photo Try on a traditional hanbok and take a memorable photo hanbok Make kimchi and find out why it's a healthy Korean staple Make kimchi and find out why it's a healthy Korean staple Enjoy the convenience of complimentary hotel transfers Enjoy the convenience of complimentary hotel transfers What We Love:   What We Love: Gain a deeper knowledge of Korean food, customs and etiquette with a traditional tea ceremony, a *hanbok* dress-up session and kimchi making class! Begin by attending a tea ceremony where your friendly guide will explain the etiquette which has recently enjoyed a revival in modern society. Afterwards, try on a colorful *hanbok*, the traditional Korean clothing dating from the Joseon period and take the opportunity to pose for a photo – say ‘Kimchi!' Next get stuck in to your kimchi-making class led by a local cook. Korea's well-loved fermented dish, primarily made from cabbage, is served at most meals and has many a positive benefit to the diet. Taste your creation or pack it up to go before heading back to your hotel, with a quick stop at the amethyst factory, a famed Korean export, on the way.

Enjoy an evening of dynastic culture. You'll be served an incredible spread of court-style foods from the Joseon period then when you're sufficiently sated, watch the talented performers of a traditional show Visit Korea House, famed for 5* performances and award-winning cuisine Feel like royalty with a lavish meal of Joseon Dynasty dishes, prepared by award-winning chefs Settle in for the 8 cultural performances involving traditional Korean song and dance Enjoy the convenience of complimentary hotel transfers Visit Korea House, famed for 5* performances and award-winning cuisine Visit Korea House, famed for 5* performances and award-winning cuisine Feel like royalty with a lavish meal of Joseon Dynasty dishes, prepared by award-winning chefs Feel like royalty with a lavish meal of Joseon Dynasty dishes, prepared by award-winning chefs Settle in for the 8 cultural performances involving traditional Korean song and dance Settle in for the 8 cultural performances involving traditional Korean song and dance Enjoy the convenience of complimentary hotel transfers Enjoy the convenience of complimentary hotel transfers What We Love:   What We Love: Receive the royal treatment at the beautiful Korea House, Seoul's famed cultural building specializing in traditional court cuisine and cultural performances. Your evening will begin with an incredible banquet of Korean dishes, as eaten in the Joseon Dynasty, prepared by superior chefs under the supervision of the world's top Korean court cuisine expert. Whether you choose the buffet or set menu, you'll experience famed dishes under the soft lighting of traditional silk lanterns. When your taste buds are satisfied, it's time for the one-hour performance of eight traditional acts with everything from fan dances to percussion to romantic drama. The show has been staged for over 32 years and enjoyed by over 1.6 million people from around the world. At the end, you'll have the opportunity to take photos with the performers in their spectacular costumes.

Marvel at the impressive acrobatics and laugh at the incessant comedy of this internationally acclaimed show Enjoy Asian martial arts and hilarious shenanigans from this unique Korean family The internationally acclaimed show has enjoyed stints on Broadway and in London The impressive stunts and slapstick humor are accessible for the whole family to enjoy Enjoy Asian martial arts and hilarious shenanigans from this unique Korean family Enjoy Asian martial arts and hilarious shenanigans from this unique Korean family The internationally acclaimed show has enjoyed stints on Broadway and in London The internationally acclaimed show has enjoyed stints on Broadway and in London The impressive stunts and slapstick humor are accessible for the whole family to enjoy The impressive stunts and slapstick humor are accessible for the whole family to enjoy What We Love:   What We Love: Set in an average Korean home, JUMP is centered on a typical but dramatically agile Korean family – from the authoritarian grandfather, drunken uncle and Taekwondo-chopping mother to the incongruous daughter's suitor. Each member is a martial arts expert, possessing championship levels of Taekwondo, acrobatic and gymnastic skills. The plot thickens when two burglars break into the house in the middle of the night – one a sleek, mean villain, the other a plump, bumbling idiot – your quintessential comedy duo. When the family discovers the intruders, a mighty battle ensures. What follows is an incredible display of acrobatic skills, Jackie Chan-like martial arts, familial shenanigans and a healthy dose of slapstick humor thrown in too!

What We Love:   What We Love: Hitting the stage in 2012 and since performing in most major global cities, 'The Painters: Hero' is a one-of-a-kind performance fusing world-renowned Korean entertainment with talented artists. This utterly innovative idea showcases the mind-blowing skills of live illustrators with incredible visual effects, alongside a witty blend of mime, dance and comedy. Using 10 different art techniques - everything from action drawing to speed drawing to a piece created from 200 Rubik's cubes - the artwork represents ‘heroes' from history, music and comics. Watch as incredible images unfold before your eyes, guess who is being brought to life, and even take the chance to get on stage yourself!

What We Love:   What We Love: Korea's famous drumming troupe come wearing heels and wrapped in leather, ready to whip you into a frenzy of rhythm and power! The all-female percussion band has enjoyed international acclaim, harmonizing femininity and sound across the world, and moving into their own exclusive theatre in Seoul in 2010. The Drum Cat performance comprises five themes: Sexy, Speedy, Funny, Powerful and Wild. A far cry from traditional drumming, the performance focuses on a modernization of rhythm: combing rock jazz, techno and Latin rhythms into a unique blend of sound. No simple rhythms here, you'll be stunned by the complexity of the pounding and powerful beats.

What We Love:   What We Love: Putting a unique Korean spin on the Romeo and Juliet story, FANTA-STICK shakes up the traditional Korean performance with a modern interpretation. The synopsis involving two families, an ethereal drum and flute and even ghosts, is based loosely on the Shakespeare classic combined with an impressive array of breakdancing, martial arts, dance and traditional Korean percussion and string music, with a healthy dollop of comedy thrown in for good measure. You'll be drawn in by the pulsating percussive rhythm and the heartwarming melodies in beautiful ‘Gukak' style (Korean traditional music), redefining how the modern world sees this ancient genre.

After a Korean-style buffet lunch, you'll visit the world's largest botanical garden before swinging by the Althr Airfield, once a Japanese army base camp, on the way to Mt Sanbang. Explore fascinating marine life by snorkelling in the tropical waters of Lipah Bay, accompanied by thousands of colourful reef fish and beautiful coral Discover this untapped coastal area recently exposed in the early 2000s Snorkel amongst a rich variety of reef fish, coral and marine organisms Get amazing snorkeling at Lipah Bay with distinct features: a Japanese Shipwreck and Pondok Vienna Beach Enjoy convenient transfers from Ubud, Kuta, Sanur and Seminyak to the snorkelling site Discover this untapped coastal area recently exposed in the early 2000s Snorkel amongst a rich variety of reef fish, coral and marine organisms Get amazing snorkeling at Lipah Bay with distinct features: a Japanese Shipwreck and Pondok Vienna Beach Enjoy convenient transfers from Ubud, Kuta, Sanur and Seminyak to the snorkelling site What We Love:   What We Love: Looking for a snorkeling trip in Bali? Jump right in and greet the colorful inhabitants of the sea. With clear and uncontaminated water, you are able to glimpse every corner of this underwater paradise. Two amazing snorkeling sites await: a Japanese shipwreck where you'll get the rare opportunity to explore a wreck without needing a dive certificate to delve into the deep; and Pondok Vienna Beach, home to a huge soft coral reef and the playground for a variety of tropical species. Cast your eyes around the surrounding scenic views and appreciate the harmony and tranquility the temple brings as the world awakens. Next you'll be led into the hidden wonders of the Secret Garden, nestled deep into Ambengan Village. Prepare yourself for the nerve-racking end to the trip - a 10 meter waterfall jump! Test your bravery as you leap and experience the moment of exhilarating free-fall from the beautiful natural falls.

This 3-in-1 day trip is the perfect mix of Balinese adventure and beauty - ideal for those with limited time on the island Watch the world awakening from Kintamani looking across to the sun rising behind Mount Batur Embark on a rice field journey at Singaraja and sip natural coconuts fresh from the tree Watch the buffalos ploughing and take a short hike through the rice fields Have a refreshing swim beneath the Sekumpul Waterfall, one of Bali's most impressive and secluded Watch the world awakening from Kintamani looking across to the sun rising behind Mount Batur Embark on a rice field journey at Singaraja and sip natural coconuts fresh from the tree Watch the buffalos ploughing and take a short hike through the rice fields Have a refreshing swim beneath the Sekumpul Waterfall, one of Bali's most impressive and secluded What We Love:   What We Love: If you only have limited time in Bali, this fun-packed adventure is certain to please, letting you experience the expansive scenery, picturesque rice fields and impressive waterfalls all in one day. It's an early start to catch the unbeatable views of the sunrise at Kintamani, overlooking famous Mount Batur mountain while you enjoy breakfast. Experience first hand the importance of rice production in Bali as you chat to locals, watch buffalo ploughing the fields and gratefully accept refreshing coconuts fetched from the nearby palms just for you. To end the day of adventure, take a dip into the lagoon beneath the towering Sekumpul Waterfall and relax as any stress washes right away. It's a pretty idyllic way to spend your day in Bali, don't you think?

First visit a local elementary school to observe the daily lives of the local children - even get the chance to teach these eager pupils. Visit Kusamba, a local fishing village, to see the people mining salt the traditional way. Next stop is Goa Lawah temple, a bat cave that dates back to the 11th century. Continue the tour at Tenganan village, one of Bali's most ancient villages that existed before the arrival of Hinduism. The village is famous for its unique textile with intricate motifs. Here you'll stop for lunch at a local restaurant before continuing to Karangasem Royal Palace, built by the first King of Karangasem. Nearby Taman Ujung Sukasada was used as a guesthouse of noble families and foreign official guests of the Karangasem Kingdom. The final stop is the old royal bathing palace of Tirtagangga ('water of the Ganges') featuring majestic fountains and pools, and boasting stunning rice paddy views – the perfect end to your East Bali experience.

Gawk at the incredible Nusa Dua scenery and satisfy your stomach rumblings with fruit juices and breakfast pastries, and when the dolphins appear, you'll soon forget the 5am start...

Spend a day speeding through Bali's rice gardens, one of the island's best-loved areas on account of its authenticity and beauty, and listen intently as your local guide relates tales of rural life. The heritage area of Jatiluwih is a less commercialized, less crowded region, boasting some of the world's most beautiful rice fields with views of Mount Batukaru in the distance. Alight from your bike to walk between the terraces, little huts, tumbling waterfalls and quaint temples before sitting down to a sumptuous lunch overlooking the stunning scenery.

Cruise through untouched rice paddies and villages dotted with traditional houses and temples. Stop for photos at scenic spots, learn about local culture and high-five playful village children as you pass. Visit Sangeh Monkey Forest to meet and feed the cheeky inhabitants, watch them swing in the trees and even swim in the river! Lunch is served with a side of spectacular views overlooking panoramic vistas of nearby Ubud.

INSTANTBook now and get your e-ticket instantly INSTANT  Book now and get your e-ticket instantly Visit Bali's outstanding bird park, on beautifully landscaped grounds, with an abundance of fascinating creatures to encounter Explore the beautiful park grounds, home to almost 1000 birds Feed birds from the palm of your hand at an interactive feeding session Watch live bird shows or visit the air-conditioned 4D theater Take photos throughout or pose for the camera with the feathered residents Explore the beautiful park grounds, home to almost 1000 birds Explore the beautiful park grounds, home to almost 1000 birds Feed birds from the palm of your hand at an interactive feeding session Feed birds from the palm of your hand at an interactive feeding session Watch live bird shows or visit the air-conditioned 4D theater Watch live bird shows or visit the air-conditioned 4D theater Take photos throughout or pose for the camera with the feathered residents Take photos throughout or pose for the camera with the feathered residents What We Love:   What We Love: Two beautiful hectares of botanical landscape have been crafted into a natural habitat-like sanctuary, research and breeding center for almost 1000 birds from 250 different species. The park features birds from Indonesia, South Africa and Latin America, as well as 2000 tropical plants. Take a tranquil stroll through the park for close encounters with these graceful birds, there's even a special area for Komodo dragons! Be sure to plan your visit around the daily activities: feed lories and pelicans, watch birds of prey in action and be entertained at the park's 4D theater before heading to the guyu guyu corner for a hands-on photo session with parrots and cockatoos!

INSTANTBook now and get your e-ticket instantly INSTANT  Book now and get your e-ticket instantly Travel through the amazing open grounds to see animals in their close-to-natural habitat and enjoy the park's shows and activity zones Embark on a safari journey, visit the petting zoo, or see an animal show Ride an elephant with the Leopard package Visit the fresh water aquarium and watch the frenzy of the piranha feeding Enjoy adrenalin-pumping rides at the Fun Zone and get wet in the Water Zone Enter the world of nocturnal animals at the Night Safari and enjoy a BBQ dinner Leopard ticket holders enjoy Express Line entry to all attractions, plus a welcome drink and lunch, and premium seating for the nightly Balinese show Embark on a safari journey, visit the petting zoo, or see an animal show Embark on a safari journey, visit the petting zoo, or see an animal show Ride an elephant with the Leopard package Ride an elephant with the Leopard package Visit the fresh water aquarium and watch the frenzy of the piranha feeding Visit the fresh water aquarium and watch the frenzy of the piranha feeding Enjoy adrenalin-pumping rides at the Fun Zone and get wet in the Water Zone Enjoy adrenalin-pumping rides at the Fun Zone and get wet in the Water Zone Enter the world of nocturnal animals at the Night Safari and enjoy a BBQ dinner Enter the world of nocturnal animals at the Night Safari and enjoy a BBQ dinner Leopard ticket holders enjoy Express Line entry to all attractions, plus a welcome drink and lunch, and premium seating for the nightly Balinese show Leopard ticket holders enjoy Express Line entry to all attractions, plus a welcome drink and lunch, and premium seating for the nightly Balinese show What We Love:   What We Love: Bali's most realistic safari experience takes you on a journey to discover the inhabitants of Indonesia, India and the African Savannah. See wildlife living naturally together in 40 hectares of park, specially landscaped to imitate natural habitats. There's even more to discover beyond the safari as the park is home to 400 residents, some of which are endangered. Find elephants, tigers, leopards, kimodo dragons, cheetahs, and orangutans, to name a few. Watch the elephants bathing or even climb on for a ride, visit the petting zoo, learn a Balinese dance, see almost 40 species of fish, and don't miss feeding time for the white tigers and piranhas! As the day draws to a close, get a thrill at Fun Zone, the mini theme park, or cool off at the Water Park before sitting down for the a spectacular theater production. A choice of packages is available: decide if you want inclusions such as an elephant ride, lunch/dinner, VIP show seating or the Night Safari

Prepare for an evening of spectacular performances, hair-raising acrobatics and world-class special effects that take you on an Indonesian journey of traditional dances with a contemporary touch Appreciate the richness of Indonesian culture through outstanding performances Observe how regional traditions range from island to island Enjoy a free shuttle pick up service Watch from the most exclusive seats and receive free tea and coffee service with VIP Tickets Appreciate the richness of Indonesian culture through outstanding performances Appreciate the richness of Indonesian culture through outstanding performances Observe how regional traditions range from island to island Observe how regional traditions range from island to island Enjoy a free shuttle pick up service Enjoy a free shuttle pick up service Watch from the most exclusive seats and receive free tea and coffee service with VIP Tickets Watch from the most exclusive seats and receive free tea and coffee service with VIP Tickets What We Love:   What We Love: An amazing combination of talented performers and incredible special effects, the Devdan Show is a must-see cultural performance when in Bali. Audience members will be taken on a journey of land and sea across the Indonesian archipelago. Starting in Bali, witness the harvest season dance, kite-flying performance and a dramatic Kecak fire dance. Next you'll be transported to Sumatra, Java, Borneo and Papua with each location sharing a glimpse of authentic traditions and modern culture, in a spectacular performance showcasing world-class dancers, acrobats and artists. As the lights dim, relax in your seat and prepare for a myriad of color, traditional costumes and daring stunts created by a team of professionals who clearly know how to put on a show. A mixture of contemporary and traditional, the show has something for every taste and is sure to have you tempted to explore more of the archipelago!

INSTANTBook now and get your e-ticket instantly INSTANT  Book now and get your e-ticket instantly Spend a day cooling off at Bali's most popular waterpark, featuring rides and services that visitors of all ages will enjoy Enjoy the park's thrilling slides and fun rides Relax in the park pools including a pleasure pool and sunken pool bar for adults Conveniently located close to Bali's southern beach area Use your Splash Band for easy cashless payments Enjoy the park's thrilling slides and fun rides Enjoy the park's thrilling slides and fun rides Relax in the park pools including a pleasure pool and sunken pool bar for adults Relax in the park pools including a pleasure pool and sunken pool bar for adults Conveniently located close to Bali's southern beach area Conveniently located close to Bali's southern beach area Use your Splash Band for easy cashless payments Use your Splash Band for easy cashless payments What We Love:   What We Love: Located in central Kuta, Waterbom is an oasis in the heart of the bustling tourist area and is Bali's most popular waterpark – and for good reason. Featuring numerous thrilling rides and child-friendly attractions, the park has something for everyone. Adults can enjoy massages or a tropical drink at the swim up bar whilst kids can head to the slides and wet play areas. Brave the pride of the park, a 70km/hr ride called Climax. Or for something more chilled, the Lazy River may suit you better. A cashless payment band means you can simply buy your credit, leave all your valuables at the locker room and enjoy all park facilities with a flash of your wrist. You're certain to find more than enough to entertain you for the whole day at what is arguably the biggest and best waterpark in Bali.

A one-of-a-kind trekking trip complete with private picnic and highlighted by a magnificent sunrise view Trek in the early morning (approx. 2:00am) to the summit of Mount Batur (1717 meters) and experience the awesome beauty of an active volcano Your personal guide / butler will escort you along the way, providing a safe and informative experience Enjoy a sumptuous breakfast meal privately set up for you Be escorted in a comfy air conditioned car Trek in the early morning (approx. 2:00am) to the summit of Mount Batur (1717 meters) and experience the awesome beauty of an active volcano Trek in the early morning (approx. 2:00am) to the summit of Mount Batur (1717 meters) and experience the awesome beauty of an active volcano Your personal guide / butler will escort you along the way, providing a safe and informative experience Your personal guide / butler will escort you along the way, providing a safe and informative experience Enjoy a sumptuous breakfast meal privately set up for you Enjoy a sumptuous breakfast meal privately set up for you Be escorted in a comfy air conditioned car Be escorted in a comfy air conditioned car What We Love:   What We Love: For all sunrise lovers – this experience is perfect. You will be escorted by private vehicle to the trekking start point. After a safety briefing, hike up Mount Batur's volcanic cone for 2 hours with your friendly local guide. As you arrive at the top, your personal butler will serve you a light breakfast of tea, coffee and pastries. Enjoy the meal while relishing the moment when the sun moves up over the horizon, casting a shimmering glow over the vast crater lake. After breakfast, you will be escorted back to the start point. Along the way, notice the paths of destruction created by the lava flow of volcanic eruptions.

Snorkel the pristine waters around a WWII wreck and a coral garden. Hundreds of beautiful fish and brightly colored coral are accessible, less than 3 meters below the surface Snorkel at Bali's premier dive sites: the USAT Liberty shipwreck and the neighboring Coral Garden Have a briefing by your guide to ensure you're happy with the equipment All abilities can snorkel, you just need to feel comfortable in the water Enjoy a well-deserved lunch after the experience Transfer from your hotel and back in air conditioned comfort Snorkel at Bali's premier dive sites: the USAT Liberty shipwreck and the neighboring Coral Garden Snorkel at Bali's premier dive sites: the USAT Liberty shipwreck and the neighboring Coral Garden Have a briefing by your guide to ensure you're happy with the equipment Have a briefing by your guide to ensure you're happy with the equipment All abilities can snorkel, you just need to feel comfortable in the water All abilities can snorkel, you just need to feel comfortable in the water Enjoy a well-deserved lunch after the experience Enjoy a well-deserved lunch after the experience Transfer from your hotel and back in air conditioned comfort Transfer from your hotel and back in air conditioned comfort What We Love:   What We Love: Snorkel at one of Bali's best dive sites and take the rare opportunity to snorkel a WWII wreck. The USAT Liberty, torpedoed by the Japanese, now rests off Bali's northern shores. Covering depths from 3 to 30 meters, while divers swim down to the ship's deeper crevices, snorkelers can enjoy the shipwreck's shallower parts. Not to mention the huge and colorful range of fish that have made the USAT Liberty their home. After lunch, float over to the Coral Garden, a wall of marine life that offer's some spectacular underwater exploration. This full day of snorkeling includes hotel transfers, lunch, all equipment and even a briefing to make sure you're comfortable in the water.

The colorful costumes, talented dancers and quirky actors will surely start your day with a smile. Browse the delicate gold and silver handcrafted jewelry at Celuk village before seeing impressive wood carpentry in action at Mas. You'll meet the artisans for a better understanding of the creative process. The journey continues to Kintamani for a local lunch facing the majestic cone of Batur Volcano and its vast crater lake. Visit Tirta Empul Temple famed for its cleansing holy springs before arriving at Gunung Kawi Royal Monument with its impressive valley views, royal tombs and hermitage caves. End the day with the most spectacular of Bali's iconic rice terrace views near Tegalalang. If you want to purchase a Balinese art piece as a memento of your day of culture, stops can be made along the way at Ubud's many galleries.

Discover authentic village life at one of Bali's most secluded villages and experience some unique and chilling funeral traditions Journey across the beautiful Lake Batur to gain an insight into the funeral rituals of Trunyan Village Take in fabulous views of Bali's famed rice terraces and browse for artsy souvenirs at Ubud's traditional market Enjoy a traditional Balinese lunch included in the tour Relax in air conditioned comfort, with pick up and drop off included, and an informative English speaking guide Journey across the beautiful Lake Batur to gain an insight into the funeral rituals of Trunyan Village Journey across the beautiful Lake Batur to gain an insight into the funeral rituals of Trunyan Village Take in fabulous views of Bali's famed rice terraces and browse for artsy souvenirs at Ubud's traditional market Take in fabulous views of Bali's famed rice terraces and browse for artsy souvenirs at Ubud's traditional market Enjoy a traditional Balinese lunch included in the tour Enjoy a traditional Balinese lunch included in the tour Relax in air conditioned comfort, with pick up and drop off included, and an informative English speaking guide Relax in air conditioned comfort, with pick up and drop off included, and an informative English speaking guide What We Love:   What We Love: Sick of the same old tourist sights? Well, prepare for something completely different. Explore Bali's darkest corners as you discover authentic village life, culture and tradition on this day tour of Bali's spookier side. It starts with a scenic journey to Mount Batur where a boat is waiting to take you across the lake to mysterious Trunyan village. This isolated village, only accessible by boat, has some sinister traditions. Inhabited by Bali Aga, descendants of the original Balinese, the funereal custom is to leave the dead to decompose within rudimentary bamboo cages, creating a macabre scene of skulls and bones, whilst the stench is absorbed by the fragrances of a nearby Taru Menyan tree. After this chilling but fascinating encounter, sail back to your lunch stop of traditional Balinese fare. There's time to see the panoramic views of the luscious expanses of Bali's famed rice terraces before a cultural stop off at majestic Ubud Palace and a browse of the market for arty souvenirs.

Tuck into a well-deserved delectable buffet lunch included in the trip Make use of the hot showers and fresh towels provided when you come off the river Enjoy air conditioned transport including hotel pick up and drop off Raft with Sobek, one of Bali's leading and safest operators, with over two decades of experience Raft with Sobek, one of Bali's leading and safest operators, with over two decades of experience Paddle down the rapids of Telagawaja River, a medium-level (Class III-IV) route with some challenges to test your skills! Paddle down the rapids of Telagawaja River, a medium-level (Class III-IV) route with some challenges to test your skills! Tuck into a well-deserved delectable buffet lunch included in the trip Tuck into a well-deserved delectable buffet lunch included in the trip Make use of the hot showers and fresh towels provided when you come off the river Make use of the hot showers and fresh towels provided when you come off the river Enjoy air conditioned transport including hotel pick up and drop off Enjoy air conditioned transport including hotel pick up and drop off What We Love:   What We Love: This exciting adventure takes you through the 16km of the Telagawaja's white water rapids, a medium route for rafting enthusiasts that also remains suitable for beginners and families (so long as you have a taste for adventure!) Rafting operators in Bali vary greatly but you can feel at ease with Bali Sobek's 100% safety record and over 20 years of experience. The professional guides are hugely experienced and have a great sense of humor, continuously receiving outstanding reviews from contented rafters. The course is renowned for having the most beautiful surrounding scenery: huge expanses of green plantations, mountainous terrain and waterfalls cascading down from the cliffs. Navigate overhead obstacles, narrow gorges and your final challenge, the Water Dam! Located far from any city pollution, the nature and air here feel noticeably fresher and cleaner. After around 2 hours of rafting, there are hot showers, clean towels and a scrumptious buffet lunch waiting for you at the end.

Bali Sobek are a firm favorite: renowned as the island's safest operator, they're a pioneer of white water rafting in Bali, and ambassadors for international standard equipment. Though perfect for beginners and families, don't expect the route to be too easy, for the Ayung is sure to give you a thrill! It's no surprise this is Bali's most popular river for year-round rafting. Not only does the river provide rafting accessible to all experience levels but it also showcases Bali's beautiful nature and interesting canyon wall carvings, not to mention that it's just 5km outside of Ubud.

Watch the sun go down behind beautiful Pura Luhur Uluwatu, as a talented troupe perform traditional Balinese song and dance Visit Luhur Uluwatu Temple, spectacularly built at the edge of a sheer cliff face Watch a traditional Kecak dance performance, accompanied to the music of 50 men chanting in powerful unison Relax in air conditioned comfort, with hotel pick up and drop off included Visit Luhur Uluwatu Temple, spectacularly built at the edge of a sheer cliff face Visit Luhur Uluwatu Temple, spectacularly built at the edge of a sheer cliff face Watch a traditional Kecak dance performance, accompanied to the music of 50 men chanting in powerful unison Watch a traditional Kecak dance performance, accompanied to the music of 50 men chanting in powerful unison Relax in air conditioned comfort, with hotel pick up and drop off included Relax in air conditioned comfort, with hotel pick up and drop off included What We Love:   What We Love: Be mesmerized by the awe-inspiring sight of the setting sun against the beautiful Uluwatu Temple, with the shimmering Indian Ocean as a backdrop. Perched majestically atop a steep cliff side and home to a tribe of friendly monkeys, Uluwatu is one of a series of temples built to protect the island from evil spirits. Whilst here, settle in for a dramatic Kecak Dance Performance, a show of almost tribal choreography involving the percussive chants of 50 waistcloth-clad men, and flames for lighting as the evening draws in.

Explore the urban beauty of Kuala Lumpur on an exciting half-day tour, including its symbolic attractions from the Petronas Twin Towers to the National Museum and more Discover the modern and enigmatic Kuala Lumpur on a fun half day tour Visit the National Mosque, the King's Palace, the National Museum and more See the world's tallest twin towers — Petronas Twin Towers and don't forget to snap a selfie or three Pick up a few memorable souvenirs on the city streets and share the exciting memories with your loved ones back home Discover the modern and enigmatic Kuala Lumpur on a fun half day tour Visit the National Mosque, the King's Palace, the National Museum and more See the world's tallest twin towers — Petronas Twin Towers and don't forget to snap a selfie or three Pick up a few memorable souvenirs on the city streets and share the exciting memories with your loved ones back home What We Love:   What We Love: Explore the history and top landmarks of one of the world's most modern cities — Kuala Lumpur. Learn the story behind some of the city's most iconic sights as you tour the busy streets and discover quiet charming corners. Take pictures of the some of the tallest skyscrapers — Petronas Twin Towers. Admire the unique architecture of the King's Palace (Istana Negara), the National Mosque (Masjid Negara) and visit the National Monument and Sultan Abdul Ahmad Building. Watch how local handcrafted souvenirs are made and take a few back home for friends and family.
strTitle: Kuala Lumpur Half Day City Tour

strIntroduction: There is so much more to Kuala Lumpur than skyscrapers and shopping! Explore the city's age-old traditions and customs on a half day tour of its suburbs and villages with an exciting visit to Batu Caves Leave the busy city behind for a chance to explore Kuala Lumpur's beautiful countryside Visit the rural Malay villages, the Royal Selangor Pewter, Batik Factory and more Discover the Batu Caves, a Hindu temple and catch a glimpse of the city from the height of 272 steps Learn about Malaysia's rich history, traditions and customs in the suburbs Leave the busy city behind for a chance to explore Kuala Lumpur's beautiful countryside Visit the rural Malay villages, the Royal Selangor Pewter, Batik Factory and more Discover the Batu Caves, a Hindu temple and catch a glimpse of the city from the height of 272 steps Learn about Malaysia's rich history, traditions and customs in the suburbs What We Love:   What We Love: Escape bustling Kuala Lumpur and into the historically and culturally rich suburbs of the city. Explore the magnificent Malaysian countryside and discover local village life. Visit the Royal Selangor Pewter, producing pewters for ceremonial use and feel the special texture of the Batik-silk cloth at the Batik factory. Venture further away from the city and wander in the fascinating limestone caves before hiking up into a Hindu Temple. This half day journey will reward you with new interesting facts about Malaysia, unforgettable memories and stunning views of Kuala Lumpur's skyline.
strTitle: Kuala Lumpur Suburbs and Batu Caves

strIntroduction: Discover the cultural and historical heritage of Kuala Lumpur on an exciting 5 hour tour with visits to the city's oldest temples and bustling markets Dive into history and tradition of Kuala Lumpur, getting to know the city's unique mixed background Visit the Kuala Lumpur's oldest Buddhist, Hindu and Taoist temples Shop till you drop at the Central Market and sample exotic delicacies in Chinatown Watch how Kuala Lumpur's many cultures, religions and traditions co-exist peacefully within a step of each other Dive into history and tradition of Kuala Lumpur, getting to know the city's unique mixed background Visit the Kuala Lumpur's oldest Buddhist, Hindu and Taoist temples Shop till you drop at the Central Market and sample exotic delicacies in Chinatown Watch how Kuala Lumpur's many cultures, religions and traditions co-exist peacefully within a step of each other What We Love:   What We Love: Discover Kuala Lumpur's rich historical heritage, age-old traditions, peculiar customs and more on the full day Culture and Heritage Tour. Experience a diverse mix of cultures that make Kuala Lumpur the exciting and versatile city that it is and peek into its intricate and exciting past. On this tour, you will get to visit one of the largest and oldest Buddhist temples in Malaysia, the oldest Hindu Temple in Kuala Lumpur as well as the city's oldest Taoist temple, Sze Yeh Temple. Swing by the Kuala Lumpur Central Market and explore the bustling Chinatown, the perfect place to polish your bargaining skills.

Spend the day in the pleasant company of the world's friendliest giants at the Elephant Sanctuary, see the elephants in their natural habitat and have fun giving them a bath Meet one of the world's largest and friendliest animals in a natural and protected environment Learn about the Elephant Relocation Team that has been moving elephants who have lost their habitats since 1974 Under the rangers' supervision, you will get to have fun while giving the elephants a bath Don't forget to take plenty of photos to keep as memories or reminders of the sanctuary's important and noble work Meet one of the world's largest and friendliest animals in a natural and protected environment Learn about the Elephant Relocation Team that has been moving elephants who have lost their habitats since 1974 Under the rangers' supervision, you will get to have fun while giving the elephants a bath Don't forget to take plenty of photos to keep as memories or reminders of the sanctuary's important and noble work What We Love:   What We Love: Meet one of the most majestic animals in the world — the mighty elephant — in a conservation area dedicated specifically to them. Established all the way back in 1989 by the Department of Wildlife and National Parks, the Elephant Sanctuary is a great place to see how elephants live and interact in a natural environment. If you are ready to get up close and personal, you will get a chance to bathe the elephants using special brushes — under the watchful eye of the park rangers, of course. You will also get to learn about the sanctuary's efforts to relocate the elephants whose habitats have been threatened and discover the challenges facing the friendly giants in today's rapidly developing world.

Journey back in time and visit the beautiful old city of Malacca, the historical state of Malaysia rich in heritage landmarks, ancient buildings and ruins Explore Malacca, the capital of the 'The Historic State' of Malaysia, only a couple of hours away from the center of Kuala Lumpur Malacca is also Malaysia's first UNESCO World Heritage Site for Culture Admire the beautiful architecture of intact historical buildings and explore the mystery of old ruins Visit the Malacca Museum, A'Formosa Portuguese Fortress, St. Peter's Church and more Enjoy a delicious stopover for an authentic Peranakan lunch included in the tour Explore Malacca, the capital of the 'The Historic State' of Malaysia, only a couple of hours away from the center of Kuala Lumpur Malacca is also Malaysia's first UNESCO World Heritage Site for Culture Admire the beautiful architecture of intact historical buildings and explore the mystery of old ruins Visit the Malacca Museum, A'Formosa Portuguese Fortress, St. Peter's Church and more Enjoy a delicious stopover for an authentic Peranakan lunch included in the tour What We Love:   What We Love: Visit the historic city of Malacca, a living museum boasting both fully preserved old buildings and ruins right in its heart. Located only 2 hours away from Kuala Lumpur city center, Malacca takes you back to a different time as you wander its narrow streets and historical squares. On the Historical Malacca Tour, you will get to visit St. Peter's Church, A'Formosa Portuguese Fortress, Malacca Museum, Chen Hoon Teng Temple and more. Stop by for a quick break and enjoy a relaxing lunch as you sample the best of Peranakan cuisine before continuing your discovery along the Malacca River.
